Posted By: MyrBattlecube (2/17/2011 8:02:17 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: In my opinion, this guy has 1 of 2 missions in life, take your pick. A) A fishing lure. B) A kamikaze. Played against him at the prerelease, twice it was dropped early & for obvious reasons caught 1 of my removal spells which means you're doing something right but, nothing to celebrate over, right? The other round, he hit the field late, somewhere after turn 6 @ which point my focus was on cards like Victor H, Elspeth, etc. He was able to hang on for a full round, attacked, made his mates a wee-bit scarier & was then blocked by a hawk before leaving the battle grinning. That I believe was his "good death". Thing about him being a late game drop is.. You need to have at least 3+ late game, low cmc cards, able to make a game changing or finishing impact when dropped in order to make it a good plan. My opponent did not, he came close that round but was missing something. To conclude- AP is a limited role player at best with a juicy cmc but, unless he's in your tackle box, things need to g... posts.post_content:
I love this card, i love the balance in this card. Would be awesome if it had full art though! :D haha but it's a great card for white weenie and knights really are coming up in the world. They have an amazing deck slowly coming together.
  
   
1st turn: Plains, Student of Warfare
  
2nd turn: Plains, Accorder Paladin opp. life:19
  
3rd turn: Plains, Knight Exemplar or Mirran Crusader opp. life:12- if Knight Exemplar
  
4th turn: Plains, Hero of Bladehold opp. life: 2
  
5th turn: Plains, Hero of Bladehold opp. life: DEAD
  
   
Obviously we'll have blockers so maybe it won't turn out like that always lol but that's what we got Sun Titan or Wurmcoil for! I prefer Wurmcoil. 2 copies would be nice. But that reoccurring Double Striking MIrran or Indestructable giving baddie are pretty nice every turn.
  
   
And the most exci... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
